title: Galvanic lithotrophy, a new path to fuel bioelectrochemical processes
content:
Environ. Sci.: Water Res. Technol., 2024, Accepted Manuscript
DOI: 10.1039/D4EW00186A, Paper
Carlos Norberto Rodríguez Simón, Sebastian Bonanni, Juan Pablo Pablo Busalmen
Electron sources for bacterial cell processes are diverse and include water (in phototrophs), organic (in organotrophs) and inorganic compounds (in lithotrophs). All of them share the characteristic of having a...
